title.narrative: Hope and knowledge in the 2030 Agenda - building a sustainable future
Toivo ja tieto Agenda 2030:ssa - kestavaa tulevaisuutta rakentamassa

description.narrative: The project themes are UN?s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs 4 5 10 16) and global responsibility. Due to the interdependence of the 2030 Agenda goals selected goals are also linked to all other goals. Issues of peace and global interdependence and thei r relation to development and global justice are approached through concrete examples and dramatized stories. This enables Finnish pupils to relate to the reality of developing countries from their own experiences.The project will reinforce young people?s sense of inclusion in society and encourage them to be active global citizens. Alongside the global development challenges the pupils are told about positive change and encouraged to act on their own. Themes of causation are discussed and skills of affecti on practiced in order to achieve SDGs. The project will employ experiential and action-based teaching methods in particular methods of participatory drama which evoke thoughts emotions and empathy.Teacher students? skills as global educators are strengthen ed through trainings.Project activities:- Providing teacher students with trainings to support global education with a view to offering skills and tools they can use in their global education work at schools- Providing school students in the Helsinki metro politan area Turku Tampere and Uusimaa's Swedish-speaking areas with activity programs on Peace and development- The activity programs will be implemented using dramatized stories (process drama method) in which the project themes are explored through met hods of drama. The plots of the dramatized stories are placed in the fragile states (Zambia South Sudan Kenya Afganistan). The stories specifically address the following SDGs: 4 quality education 5 gender equality 10 reduced inequalities and 16 peace and j ustice. Pedagogic content addressing central themes of this project will be developed around the dramatized stories developed during the previous project linking them to school curricula- Organizing trainings for the facilitators of activity programs. Trai nings introduce the facilitators to the SDGs inclusive drama methods and the pedagogical content produced during the project
